results.title: The Individual in the modern world
results.brief_description: The Corning Foundation and the American Council of Learned Societies in 1961 co-sponsored a second Corning conference on the theme “The Individual and the modern world”. Distinguished Americans and other world figures held informal sessions on work, education and leisure. These far ranging discussions became the subject for this film.

results.title: The Individual
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Instructions in methods of preventing communicable diseases associated with improper food handling. Illustrates habits that should be avoided by cooks and waitresses including dirty clothes and hands, untidy hair, and handling of the eating surface of crockery and cutlery.

results.title: The Indian elephant
results.brief_description: Catching and training a young work elephant. The life of the herd in the jungle; digging a pit trap over a forest path; moving the trapped elephant; the elephant overcomes his fear and submits to training; finally it is seen loading logs on to railway trucks.

results.title: The Indian army
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam takes a tour of the modern Indian army, paying special attention to a regiment that was once known as the First Bengal Lancers.

results.title: The India trip
results.creator_credit: George Pearson, ONF | NFB and Bill Davies
results.brief_description: Pondicherry, an ancient city near the Southern tip of India, was for several centuries an outpost of France. Now the French influence has faded but another, stranger, colony is growing on its outskirts - Auroville, a community of Europeans and North Americans who have come to live the contemplative life. They are devotees of Sri Aurobindo, a Bengali poet and mystic, and their guru is a ninety-four-year-old woman from France. This spiritual mecca is described in the film by Albert Jordan, a professor from Concordia University, Montreal, who, in 1971, with his family, spent a year there.

results.title: The Incredibles
results.creator_credit: John Walker, Pixar Animation Studios, Walt Disney Pictures and Brad Bird
results.brief_description: Fun, fun, fun. That is the verdict on the latest ingenious animated feature from Pixar. Based around a family of ‘supers’ (aka superheroes) “The Incredibles” introduces Robert “Mr Incredible”, consigned to a life of mind-numbing boredom in suburbia who longs for his glory days as a world saving super hero. Spiritually crushed by a pen-pushing insurance claim job, Robert toils under the daily grind in the suburbs with loyal wife Helen (“Elastigirl”) and their three children. Bob’s zest for life is revived when he is called upon by the mysterious Mirage to perform some planet-saving assignments, but he is unwittingly drawn into confrontation with an old foe who seeks to bring all the Supers down. Bob must rely on his family to help when the situation becomes desperate and the audience gets to discover how super, these Supers really are. Features the voices of Craig T. Nelson, Holly Hunter, and Samuel L. Jackson.

results.title: The Incredible San Francisco artists' soapbox derby
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films and Amanda C Pope
results.brief_description: In the spring of 1975, 104 artists of San Francisco let fly with imagination and creativity and built 75 “cars” and 32 trophies for an artists’ annual soapbox (billycart) derby. Entries were built from such diverse materials as wire, papier-mache, sage-brush and bread. They raised $20,000 for the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art.

results.title: The Incredible human machine
results.creator_credit: Irwin Rosten and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: A journey through the wondrous inner world of the human body. Explore the fascinating, microscopic universe that exists within us all. How does the eye adjust in light? How do our muscles enable us to move? How does the eardrum process sound? With the help of sophisticated photographic techniques you are now able to discover the wonders of the internal human world.

results.title: The Incredible art of animation
results.brief_description: An introduction to the basic techniques of animation, the film demonstrates the recording of sound, speech, music and the animation of sketches. Designed to stimulate interest in this art at the amateur film making level.
